thread.title: Greek prime minister calls Obama ahead of bailout pitch
thread.title_full: Greek prime minister calls Obama ahead of bailout pitch

author: Jordan Fabian
title: Greek prime minister calls Obama ahead of bailout pitch
text: Greek prime minister calls Obama ahead of bailout pitch Getty Images By Jordan Fabian - 07/07/15 12:33 PM EDT Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras phoned President Obama on Tuesday, as he seeks a financial rescue package from European leaders, according to a White House official. The call came just before Tsipras was expected to request another cash infusion during an emergency summit in Brussels to address Greece’s mounting debt crisis. The White House has urged Greek and European officials to reach an compromise that allows Greece to remain in the eurozone. But the U.S. is not playing a leading role in brokering an agreement. “Ultimately, it will be the responsibility of the Europeans to resolve it,” White House press secretary Earnest told reporters Monday.
